intro: Desmotrichum eurorum, commonly known as the European spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered yellowish-green flowers are surrounded by specialized bracts, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Desmotrichum eurorum is known for its latex-producing properties, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
